item.title: Fighting the "ME" Culture as a Homemaker
item.itunes:summary: Why the Home is Worth Fighting For in a Culture of Individualism? In a culture that celebrates rootlessness and individualism, how do we stay the course?  - "Home is the primary source of culture—what we bring to the world is often shaped by where we come from." - Research showing the impact of a stable home environment on mental health, especially for children.  “Without roots, we are left searching for a sense of home in temporary places, when the real thing requires commitment.” - "In...
item.description:
Why the Home is Worth Fighting For in a Culture of Individualism? In a culture that celebrates rootlessness and individualism, how do we stay the course?

- "Home is the primary source of culture—what we bring to the world is often shaped by where we come from."
- Research showing the impact of a stable home environment on mental health, especially for children.
 “Without roots, we are left searching for a sense of home in temporary places, when the real thing requires commitment.”
- "In a world that celebrates moving on, homemaking is about staying—and in that, it preserves what matters most."
- “Fighting for the home is about protecting a place where relationships can thrive, traditions are honored, and love is nurtured.”
- “In a culture that celebrates going alone, remember that building a home is one of the most meaningful and courageous acts of all.”

Here's your mission during the break:

  1. Clean out your spices
  2. Create a “best of” station
  3. Think outside the shelf
  4. Group utensils
  5. Utilize drawers

  7. Join Patreon www.Patreon.com/homemakerchicpodcast

item.title: All Art is Quite Useless? Really Oscar?

item.description:
Our Q and A summer continues, and you're giving us plenty to discuss! Last week a listener asked us if we had ever seen "Why Beauty Matters"... well we have now, and we're talking about it today!

Your support matters! How can you support the show!?
Visit https://toupsandco.com Get toxic-free makeup and skincare from the official Season 16 Sponsor, our friends at Toups and Co.  Use the coupon code SUMMERBEAUTY for 10% off your purchase! Tune into Patreon for makeup tips this summer!
Join us on Patreon for just a dollar a month! www.Patreon.com/homemakerchicpodcast

1. If you enjoy wine - drink Dry Farms https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic
2. Join Angela in Paris in 2024 https://parisiennefarmgirl.com/pariswithangela
3. Do you cook? - Cook better with Shaye cook.theelliotthomestead.com
4.  Get luxury linens and towels from our friends at American Blossom Linens! https://americanblossomlinens.com/Spend $245 get a free tote with the code HOMEMAKER15 and 15% off your purchase!
5.  Want to skill up in the kitchen?  Visit cook.theelliotthomestead.com for 5 new recipes and tutorials a month!
6. Do you need to preserve your harvest? Invest in a freeze-dryer. https://bit.ly/harvestrighthomemaker
 


SEASON SPONSOR DRY FARM WINES!
Get a bottle for a penny with your first order of these beautiful, biodynamic wines. Low alcohol, no sugar added wines from Europe and beyond.
https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

Get luxury linens from our friends at American Blossom Linens and save 20% with code SING20: https://americanblossomlinens.com

Find chemical-free, designer-quality skincare and makeup and save 10% with the code HMC10: https://toupsandco.com/

Clean, CLEAN with Branch Basics! https://branchbasics.com/ Coupon code HOMEMAKERCHIC

If you enjoy wine, drink Dry Farms: https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic


Be your home's BEST interior designer with Angela's Old World Design Society. Click here for ONE WEEK FREE.

Want to skill up in the kitchen? Visit cook.theelliotthomestead.com for 5 new recipes and tutorials a month!

Visit oldworld.parisiennefarmgirl.com Grab the Harvest/Holiday edition and the Summer edition and unlock access to all the 2021 lessons!

SEASON SPONSOR - House of Tocumen OUR FAVORITE rugs! www.hotrugs.net

Did you know, these beautiful, vintage handmade rugs are known to outlast their plastic counterparts by two decades!  All of the House of Tocumen rugs are heirloom quality and made from the finest cotton and sheep's wools.

JOVIAL FOODS http://www.jovialfoods.com Jovial Foods is the top supplier of einkorn flours, einkorn pasta, Italian olive oils, prepackaged einkorn snacks, and the top-rated gluten-free pasta line.

SHOW SOME LOVE

Homemaker Chic is made possible by our Patrons. If you’d like to show some love to the podcast for just $10 a month and get video forms of all the episodes and much more, you can do that over on Patreon right here. You're standing at the door.   You're in charge...  What chemicals come in, what food comes in, what's allowed, what's not allowed.  As requested, we are sharing some of our personal choices on what we allow over our  thresholds.

Join Angela's OLD WORLD DESIGN SOCIETY / oldworld.parisiennefarmgirl.com A unique combination of a magazine publication and a private online design group with private lessons taught by Angela! -The Old World Design Society is a place for individuals who cherish the elements of a bygone era. Visit oldworld.parisiennefarmgirl.com Grab the Harvest/Holiday edition and the Summer edition and unlock access to all the 2021 lessons!

SEASON SPONSOR - House of Tocumen OUR FAVORITE rugs! www.hotrugs.net

Did you know, these beautiful, vintage handmade rugs are known to outlast their plastic counterparts by two decades!  All of the House of Tocumen rugs are heirloom quality and made from the finest cotton and sheep's wools.

JOVIAL FOODS http://www.jovialfoods.com Jovial Foods is the top supplier of einkorn flours, einkorn pasta, Italian olive oils, prepackaged einkorn snacks, and the top-rated gluten-free pasta line.

item.description:
Well, well, so we are more than just Homemakers?  Even though we are all different, we're made in God's image?  WHAT?  We have different personalities, dreams and opinions.... NUANCE?  No way!

noo͞′äns″, nyoo͞′-, noo͞-äns′, nyoo͞-

noun

  1. A subtle or slight degree of difference, as in meaning, feeling, or tone; a gradation.
  2. Expression or appreciation of subtle shades of meaning, feeling, or tone.
  3. Any one of the different gradations by which a color passes from its lightest to its darkest shade; a shade of difference or variation in a color.

Join us today as we wrap up a great season and take your advice and ditch the self-senscoring.  All of the sudden we hear Taylor Swift singing, "Don't say I didn't, say I didn't warn ya."

Sip wine, in chic fashion, in your cozy home!
For clean, refreshing wines: https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

item.description:
Lots of you ask what entertains US.  So we're spilling the beans today, from guilty pleasures to true enrichment. After the counters are clean, the candle is lit and the jammies are on - let us entertain you as we share what entertains US.

Sip while you're entertained:
For clean, refreshing wines: https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic 

Drink better, not more! This is guilt-free wine, my friends. Paleo, Keto, and diet-friendly. You must try Dry Farm Wines MUCH better wines. You can get either 3, 6, or 12 bottles delivered to your door monthly. Drink Dry Farm Wines with Ang and Shaye!  https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

THANKS TO OUR SPONSORS
The Elliott Homestead Cooking Community / cook.theelliotthomestead.com This is for those home cooks out there who would love some new inspiration, ideas, and motivation in the kitchen. Each month, I create five brand new, whole-food, price-conscious, from-scratch recipes each month and either ship them to you physically in the mail or deliver them to your inbox – whichever you prefer.

American Blossom Linens / americanblossomlinens.com / Coupon Code: HOMEMAKERCHIC20 Fall is here.  We are freshening up the home and tucking in into autumnal goodness! We are doing both of these things with our American Blossom Linens.  Invest ONCE, enjoy for a lifetime.

Toups & Co  www.toupsandco.com Coupon Code: HOMEMAKER  Toups and Co. is your one-stop online shop for all things natural and organic. They do things differently! This is a company created by my friend Emily who has taken quality ingredients in makeup, skincare, and more to an entirely new level.

SHOW SOME LOVE
Homemaker Chic is made possible by our Patrons. If you’d like to show some love to the podcast for just $10 a month and get video forms of all the episodes and much more, you can do that over on Patreon right here. THANK YOU, Patrons – we love you! If you’d like to submit topic requests, you can do that by emailing Shaye and Angela at info@homemakerchicpodcast.com

SOCIAL LINKS

  • Angela

Sip wine, in chic fashion, in your cozy home!
For clean, refreshing wines: https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

item.description:
You asked for it so we are DISHING how we are staying sane this fall with menu making.  We're only a week in and it's already saving our derrière. We sharing deets and sharing our six favorite recipes with our Patrons too!
For clean, refreshing wines: https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic 

Dry Farm Wines is wine supplier that sources organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. Dry Farm Wines finds boutique, family-owned, small-scale wineries and bring their wine to the US for our tasting pleasure. This is supporting regenerative agriculture at it’s finest and it tastes delicious. Better, not more! This is guilt-free wine, my friends. Paleo, Keto, and diet-friendly. You must try Dry Farm Wines MUCH better wines. You can get either 3, 6, or 12 bottles delivered to your door monthly. Drink Dry Farm Wines with Ang and Shaye!  https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

Fangirl swooning up in here as we throw down with our new BFF Ms. Marian Parsons!  That's right, her paint is on your dresser and now her book needs to be on your shelves!
She's telling us the WHOLE scoop on what it takes to make you say, this, "FEELS LIKE HOME!"
And wait for it... fabric walls, homemakers.  FABRIC walls. 
All that homey goodness coming out today in our interview with Marian Parsons of Miss Mustard Seed fame and author of the new book, Feels Like Home.  Available for pre-order NOW!

item.description:
Today's episode is all a 'kerfuffle' as we touch top layers of what beauty means to a home, where it comes from (in reflection of our world view), and Angela gets 'farklempt' as she refuses to hold back on Harry and The Mrs.'  award for declaring the permanent size of their family.  Forget one square of toilet paper....Don't worry, Shaye's got her back and sets the record straight about what GOD says about the arrows in our quiver.   
Oh yeah- we're breaking all the rules today.  Don't say we didn't warn you.

For clean, refreshing wines: https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchicsparkling
Dry Farm Wines is a wine supplier that sources organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. Dry Farm Wines finds boutique, family-owned, small-scale wineries and brings their wine to the US for our tasting pleasure. This is supporting regenerative agriculture at its finest and it tastes delicious. As Dry Farm customers, we get to share in their love for organic, natural and traditionally made wines. Better, not more! This is guilt-free wine, my friends. Paleo, Keto, and diet-friendly. You must try Dry Farm Wines MUCH better wines. You can get either 3, 6, or 12 bottles delivered to your door monthly. Drink Dry Farm Wines with Ang and Shaye!  https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchicbubbly

Each month, I create five brand new, whole-food, price-conscious, from-scratch recipes each month and either ship them to you physically in the mail or deliver them to your inbox – whichever you prefer.

SHOW SOME LOVE
Want to see Angela's face when she realized how she pronounced today's wine?

Angela

item.description:
From inappropriately mispronounced bottles of wine to tofu, baby, banana, hammock.  We're shooting the breeze today.  Lamenting the preferability of being eaten by a cougar over being eaten by a bear and wondering aloud why trolls can't leave Monty alone.  What does this have to do with homemaking?  Well, hopefully, it makes for good laundry folding entertainment.
Don't mind us.  We're just two best friends who haven't talked all week.

For clean, refreshing wines: https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchicsparkling
Today's wine name is Muschelkalk... "KALK" :)
Dry Farm Wines is a wine supplier that sources organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. Dry Farm Wines finds boutique, family-owned, small-scale wineries and brings their wine to the US for our tasting pleasure. This is supporting regenerative agriculture at its finest and it tastes delicious. As Dry Farm customers, we get to share in their love for organic, natural and traditionally made wines. Better, not more! This is guilt-free wine, my friends. Paleo, Keto, and diet-friendly. You must try Dry Farm Wines MUCH better wines. You can get either 3, 6, or 12 bottles delivered to your door monthly. Drink Dry Farm Wines with Ang and Shaye!  https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchicbubbly

The Elliott Homestead Cooking Community / cook.theelliotthomestead.com This is for those home cooks out there who would love some new inspiration, ideas, and motivation in the kitchen. Each month, I create five brand new, whole-food, price-conscious, from-scratch recipes each month and either ship them to you physically in the mail or deliver them to your inbox – whichever you prefer.

SHOW SOME LOVE
Want to see Angela's face when she realized how she pronounced today's wine?
Homemaker Chic is made possible by our Patrons. If you’d like to show some love to the podcast for just $10 a month and get video forms of all the episodes and much more, you can do that over on Patreon right here. THANK YOU, Patrons – we love you! If you’d like to submit topic requests, you can do that by emailing Shaye and Angela at info@homemakerchicpodcast.com

SOCIAL LINKS

Angela
www.parisiennefarmgirl.


SEASON SPONSOR DRY FARM WINES!
Get a bottle for a penny with your first order of these beautiful, biodynamic wines. Low alcohol, no sugar added wines from Europe and beyond.
https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

Get luxury linens from our friends at American Blossom Linens and save 20% with code SING20: https://americanblossomlinens.com

Find chemical-free, designer-quality skincare and makeup and save 10% with the code HMC10: https://toupsandco.com/

Clean, CLEAN with Branch Basics! https://branchbasics.com/ Coupon code HOMEMAKERCHIC

If you enjoy wine, drink Dry Farms: https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

One of our most requested episodes?  Our thoughts on pacing, posturing, and preparing for home projects.  HOW to stay stane, inspired, and KIND through what can be a challenging process.

CUE THE WINE MUSIC!

For clean, refreshing wines: https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

Dry Farm Wines is a wine supplier that sources organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. Dry Farm Wines finds boutique, family-owned, small-scale wineries and brings their wine to the US for our tasting pleasure. This is supporting regenerative agriculture at its finest and it tastes delicious. As Dry Farm customers, we get to share in their love for organic, natural and traditionally made wines. Better, not more! This is guilt-free wine, my friends. Paleo, Keto, and diet-friendly. You must try Dry Farm Wines MUCH better wines. You can get either 3, 6, or 12 bottles delivered to your door monthly. Drink Dry Farm Wines with Ang and Shaye!  https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

THANKS TO OUR SPONSORS
American Blossom Linens / americanblossomlinens.com / Coupon Code: HOMEMAKERCHIC20Summer is here.  We are line drying or linens or lounging in bed after a long day of gardening and we are doing both of these things with our American Blossom Linens.  Invest ONCE, enjoy for a lifetime.

JOVIAL FOODS http://www.jovialfoods.com Jovial Foods is the top supplier of einkorn flours, einkorn pasta, Italian olive oils, prepackaged einkorn snacks, and the top-rated gluten-free pasta line.

Visit oldworld.parisiennefarmgirl.com Grab the Spring edition before it's gone on 6/19

SHOW SOME LOVE

Homemaker Chic is made possible by our Patrons. If you’d like to show some love to the podcast for just $10 a month and get video forms of all the episodes and much more, you can do that over on Patreon right here. THANK YOU, Patrons – we love you! If you’d like to submit topic requests, you can do that by emailing Shaye and Angela at info@homemakerchicpodcast.com

item.description:
To view the entire episode in video form, become a Patron of Homemaker Chic right here.

Spilled Eggs and Secret Salsa.   We did WHAT?  Join us as we recount our memorable Mother's Day experiences (including lots of sweating and an HGTV Marathon) and then we move on to some rather awkward confessions of rotten chicken stock, Shaye's 8 dozen spilled eggs, and how Ang closed the drawer on spilled salsa... literally.

CUE THE WINE MUSIC!

For clean, refreshing wines: https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic 

Dry Farm Wines is wine supplier that sources organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. Dry Farm Wines finds boutique, family owned, small scale wineries and bring their wine to the US for our tasting pleasure. This is supporting regenerative agriculture at it’s finest and it tastes delicious. As Dry Farm customers, we get to share in their love for organic, natural, and traditionally made wines. Better, not more! This is guilt free wine, my friends. Paleo, Keto, and diet friendly. You must try Dry Farm Wines MUCH better wines. You can get either 3, 6, or 12 bottles delivered to your door monthly. Drink Dry Farm Wines with Ang and Shaye and get a free bottle with your first order!  https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

THANKS TO OUR SPONSORS

OLD WORLD DESIGN SOCIETY / oldworld.parisiennefarmgirl.com

SPRING PRE-SALE GOES LIVE on 3/26!  GET YOUR PRINT VERSION! The Old World Design Society is a place for individuals who cherish the elements of a bygone era. It’s for people who live by the motto that ‘new is not always better’ and have a collective love for the lived-in spaces and heirloom pieces that make a ‘house’ a ‘home’. Craving inspiration? Velvet sofas, gilded frames, ironstone, hand-sewn linens, vintage books, regal estates, and charming cottages? As a part of the Old World Design Society, you’ll have access to rich, inspiring creativity and education and, best of all, you’ll meet friends who speak your language. Enjoy a quarterly publication (paper or digital), online group support, design challenge

item.description:
Farming.  It's not for everyone, but we've had some requests on how to bring all the farmy feels into life 'in town'.  Today Angela and Shaye are sharing with you the little changes we made on our own homes and routines long before we each had a dairy cow.  Farming was our dream, it's not everyone's dream... but who doesn't love a breeze blowing thru an open window and a farm-fresh egg.  Join us today as we give our best ideas on all the farm vibes from home decor to stocking your fridge, no matter where you live.

You need refreshing, CLEAN, small farm Wine for Spring!!! CUE THE WINE MUSIC!
https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic Today’s “What We’re Sipping” segment is brought to you by Dry Farm Wines is an online wine subscription that pairs organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. As Dry Farm customers, we get to share in their love for organic, natural, and traditionally made wines.  “better, not more.” So check out their better wines. You can get either 3,6 or 12 bottles delivered to your door monthly. Drink Dry Farm Wines with Ang and Shaye!

Today's show is also brought to by:
https://www.americanblossomlinens.com
These are craftsman sewn sheets that are sustainably grown, dyed, and manufactured. Use coupon code HOMEMAKERCHIC2O for a 20% discount.

and

cook.theelliotthomestead.com 
The Cooking Community was created for all the women out there who are needing some motivation to thrive in their kitchen.  Each month, I create five brand new whole-food based recipes from my cottage kitchen. You can grow in confidence in your skills and feel peace in knowing that these recipes are nourishing you and your family. 



SEASON SPONSOR DRY FARM WINES!
Get a bottle for a penny with your first order of these beautiful, biodynamic wines. Low alcohol, no sugar added wines from Europe and beyond.
https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

item.description:
We've been waiting for this one!  Join us as we get to know Alena Pettitt of The Darling Academy.  She's been called the 'bravest woman in England' and now we know why!   From a London beauty industry marketing guru to Homemaker advocate extraordinaire, she's building an apron-clad army, giving permission to women around the world to make the choice to be a homemaker! 
We're going to be looking into stereotypes, judgment, and why as women, we can make any choice we want and be applauded... except THAT choice.

Cue the wine music!
You need refreshing, CLEAN Wine for Spring!!! CUE THE WINE MUSIC!
https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchicrose Today’s “What We’re Sipping” segment is brought to you by Dry Farm Wines is an online wine subscription that pairs organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. As Dry Farm customers, we get to share in their love for organic, natural, and traditionally made wines.  “better, not more.” So check out their better wines. You can get either 3,6 or 12 bottles delivered to your door monthly. Drink Dry Farm Wines with Ang and Shaye!
Try our new Rose special for Spring!   Three bottles of rosé plus a bonus bottle for a penny!  https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchicrose

Today's show is brought to you by the OLD WORLD DESIGN SOCIETY!   https://www.parisiennefarmgirl.com/old-world-design-society Just 100 copies of the print publication left!  The Old World Design Society is a place for individuals who cherish the elements of a bygone era. It’s for people who live by the motto that ‘new is not always better’ and have a collective love for the lived-in spaces and heirloom pieces that make a ‘house’ a ‘home’. Craving inspiration? Velvet sofas, gilded frames, ironstone, hand-sewn linens, vintage books, regal estates, and charming cottages? As a part of the Old World Design Society, you’ll have access to rich, inspiring creativity and education and, best of all, you’ll meet friends who speak your language. Enjoy a quarterly publication (paper or digital), online group support, design challenges, early access to Angela's Private Collection Sales, and more! 


SEASON SPONSOR DRY FARM WINES!
Get a bottle for a penny with your first order of these beautiful, biodynamic wines. Low alcohol, no sugar added wines from Europe and beyond.
https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

It's not you.  It's us.
OK, maybe it's you too.  We're in this TOGETHER and today we are looking at procrastination with our Thursday panties on.  Do we need to grow up?  Own it?  Make changes and move FORWARD in this area?  We do. 
Do you?

PS: Angela finally called the dentist.

Don't procrastinate on cueing the wine music!
You need refreshing, CLEAN Wine for Spring!!! CUE THE WINE MUSIC!
https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic Today’s “What We’re Sipping” segment is brought to you by Dry Farm Wines is an online wine subscription that pairs organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. Try our new Rose special for Spring!   Three bottles of rosé plus a bonus bottle for a penny!
DON'T PROCRASTINATE!  https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchicrose

WE SHEET YOU NOT!
https://www.americanblossomlinens.com
Established in 1899, American Blossom Linens is an all-American company that turns organic, Texas grown cotton into old-fashioned, dye-free, chemical-free sheets and linens. Here’s a great review called “I Sheet You Not”: Honestly, I have searched a long time for sheets that not only have a certain feel, but are made in the USA. My search is over because of the fantastic product produced by American Blossom Linens. These sheets fit and hug the bed, which means my husband, a restless sleeper, can’t untuck these fitted sheets. There’s extra length and width to the top sheet, and even pillowcases are little longer. I loved these sheets that are crisp and heavy, but with substance not so much with weight, so much that I bought three more sets - one for each of our married kids! A big plus for me is the option of king or standard pillowcases with your order. Worth every penny!!! mThese sheets feel fabulous on your skin, keep you cool in the heat of the spring and summer, and will actually grow softer the more you wash them. These are c

item.description:
From nose jobs to alarm clocks. This is another conversation where we share what's working, and lament the padding out bras still need.

Jovial Foods is an amazing company, run by husband and wife team Carla and Rodolfo. After they discovered years ago that their daughter had a gluten sensitivity, they struck out to find grains that her body could easily digest and thrive off eating – and that led them to einkorn. Now, Jovial Foods is the top supplier of einkorn flours, einkorn pastas, Italian olive oils, prepackaged einkorn snacks, and the top-rated gluten-free pasta line. This flour will change your baking world! Use coupon code HOMEMAKER to get 10%  off your order!

item.description:
The Queen is 94 years old and as fabulous as ever.  She must be doing SOMEthing right and today we are going to talk longevity and regal homemaking with Bryan Kozlowski, author of Long Live the Queen for a two-part interview to celebrate the end of Season 5.

Today's show is brought to you by Angela's OLD WORLD DESIGN SOCIETY!
The Old World Design Society is a place for individuals who cherish the elements of a bygone era. It’s for people who live by the motto that ‘new is not always better’ and have a collective
love for the lived-in spaces and heirloom pieces that make a ‘house’ a ‘home’.
Craving inspiration?
Velvet sofas, gilded frames, ironstone, hand-sewn linens, vintage books, regal estates, and charming cottages? If words like these are a part of your language, it can be difficult to find your way through a maze of all-white social media feeds. As a part of the Old World Design Society, you’ll have access to rich, inspiring creativity and education and, best of all, you’ll meet friends who speak your language.
Enjoy a quarterly publication (paper or digital), online group support, design challenges, early access to Angela's Private Collection Sales and more!
JOIN the WINTER SESSION at https://www.parisiennefarmgirl.com/ol...​

item.description:
We had our honorary co-host joing us again and we're having our favorite conversation!  How can the homemaker stay chic?  And then some!

Today's show is brought to you by Angela's OLD WORLD DESIGN SOCIETY!
The Old World Design Society is a place for individuals who cherish the elements of a bygone era. It’s for people who live by the motto that ‘new is not always better’ and have a collective
love for the lived-in spaces and heirloom pieces that make a ‘house’ a ‘home’.
Craving inspiration?
Velvet sofas, gilded frames, ironstone, hand-sewn linens, vintage books, regal estates, and charming cottages? If words like these are a part of your language, it can be difficult to find your way through a maze of all-white social media feeds. As a part of the Old World Design Society, you’ll have access to rich, inspiring creativity and education and, best of all, you’ll meet friends who speak your language.
Enjoy a quarterly publication (paper or digital), online group support, design challenges, early access to Angela's Private Collection Sales and more!
JOIN the WINTER SESSION at https://www.parisiennefarmgirl.com/old-world-design-society

Cue the WINE MUSIC!   https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic
Today’s “What We’re Sipping” segment is brought to you by Dry Farm Wines is an online wine subscription that pairs organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. As Dry Farm customers, we get to share in their love for organic, natural, and traditionally made wines.  “better, not more.” So check out their better wines. Shoulder pads and polka dots.  Turns out we each buy most of our clothing second-hand, but' we're still pretty curious about what's HOT for Spring.

Today's show is brought to you by Angela's OLD WORLD DESIGN SOCIETY!
The Old World Design Society is a place for individuals who cherish the elements of a bygone era. It’s for people who live by the motto that ‘new is not always better’ and have a collective
love for the lived-in spaces and heirloom pieces that make a ‘house’ a ‘home’.
Craving inspiration?
Velvet sofas, gilded frames, ironstone, hand-sewn linens, vintage books, regal estates, and charming cottages? If words like these are a part of your language, it can be difficult to find your way through a maze of all-white social media feeds. As a part of the Old World Design Society, you’ll have access to rich, inspiring creativity and education and, best of all, you’ll meet friends who speak your language.

Today's show is brought to you by:
Jovial Foods. Jovial Foods is a company that supplies us homemakers with the most gorgeous baking flours and foods. Jovial is most well known for their einkorn flour, which is a high-protein, weak gluten flour that bakes up buttery and rich.  Amelie made a delicious Einkorn chocolate cake this weekend.  My girls love to grab the Einkorn cookbook and try new things. This is a company that has an extreme love for high-quality ingredients which is why we welcome them into our pantries and into our kitchens. Dang.  This was a fun one. 
We covered it ALL and we announced a winner for the queen size sheets!
Shaye's musing a modern Renaissance and Angela finally broke down crying about Covid.   Has isolation pushed us towards a heightened state of contribution to humanity?  How long CAN a person sit and consume Netflix?   The mind reels... here we go!

THE HOLIDAYS ARE COMING! Get your "penny bottle" now by visiting https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic
This is the part of the podcast where we encourage you to pour a glass of whatever scratches your itch, for us, that means a bottle of wine. Our wine segment is sponsored by Dry Farm Wines which is a fabulous online company that will ship you organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, no-garbage wines from all around the world. This is wine that is grown and bottled to help you tap into life and celebrate it!

American Blossom Linens  - COUPON CODE: HOMEMAKERCHIC20   We LOVE our modern vintage sheets made from Texas-grown cotton… no dyes, no imported fabrics here -  Turn your bedroom into an organic, chic oasis by using the promo code HOMEMAKERCHIC20, and get an exclusive 20% off discount just for listening to the show.

item.description:
I guess we can't help ourselves.   Chin hairs?  Faux eyelashes?   Covid and beauty routines?  Why bother?   
Here we are again.   Ang confesses to wearing a LOT of mascara (with no apparent shame) and Shaye recalls weaning herself off bleach blond hair.
Should we care about our looks?   Why can't we just give other women a break?   Turns out, our toilette, like so much else, turns out to be a matter of the heart.

Patreon Love: A massive thank you to our Patrons over on Patreon www.patreon.com/homemakerchicpodcast. item.description:
Wooosh - Thanksgiving is over and we're looking forward to December.   How do we juggle normal, everyday homemaking with the added fun of the Holidays?   How do you make time for the extra activities?  What if you don't even LIKE the extra activities?   Ang is under the weather and Shaye is under the gun with farm chores.  It's time for a catch-up chat while we hash it all out.

CUE THE WINE MUSIC! Today’s “What We’re Sipping” segment is brought to you by Dry Farm Wines. Dry Farms is an online wine subscription that pairs organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. As Dry Farm customers, we get to share in their love for organic, naturally and traditionally made wines.  “better, not more.” So check out their better wines. You can get either 3,6 or 12 bottles delivered to your door monthly.
Drink Dry Farm Wines with Ang and Shaye!   Shop and Sip at:  https://bit.ly/ ryFarmWinewithHomemakerChic

Today’s episode is brought to you by:
OUR AMAZON LINK
https://amzn.to/3fdxEgu
Shop Amazon for ANYTHING with this link at no extra cost to you!

American Blossom Linens  - COUPON CODE: HOMEMAKERCHIC20   We LOVE our modern vintage sheets made from Texas-grown cotton… no dyes, no imported fabrics here -  Turn your bedroom into an organic, chic oasis by using the promo code HOMEMAKERCHIC20, and get an exclusive 20% off discount just for listening to the show.

Jovial Foods. Jovial Foods is a company that supplies us, homemakers, with the most gorgeous baking flours and foods. Jovial is most well known for their einkorn flour, which is a high-protein, weak gluten flour that bakes up buttery and rich.  This is a company that has an extreme love for high-quality ingredients which is why we welcome them into our pantries and into our kitchens. Visit them at jovialfoods.com and enjoy their free shipping! Coupon Code: HOMEMAKER

Good grief - We've hardly spoken to each other all week it's time to get CAUGHT up with each other and with YOU!

You NEED Dry Farms on hand for entertaining!  CUE the wine music!
Get your "penny bottle" now by visiting https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic
This is the part of the podcast where we encourage you to pour a glass of whatever scratches your itch, for us, that means a bottle of wine. Our wine segment is sponsored by Dry Farm Wines which is a fabulous online company that will ship you organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, no-garbage wines from all around the world. This is wine that is grown and bottled to help you tap into life and celebrate it!   Today's wine is a bubbly and we think you NEED some!   Try Dry Farm Wines along with the thousands of Homemaker Chic listeners who love it and let us know what YOU think!

We all know someone whose Holidays will be in need of our hospitality and tenderness.  A gentle hand, a listening year, a generous pocket book, a hot meal....
You've heard us mention her before and today we'd like to introduce Audrey and invite her to share her story.   Audrey shares a cup of coffee with us and shares with us her incredible story and how to care for people in our lives who are struggling with big issues.   

We invite you to generously support Audrey and "Danica the Brave" at https://bit.ly/35y1AlM
Or at Venmo - Audrey Taylor @DanicatheBraveFamily #6067

You guessed it.  Season 4 is all hosting, entertaining, and the holidays.  But let's start with ground zero.  "Hospitality".   It's more than entertaining, it's more than being the hostess with the mostess... join us as we unpack what we believe is the "art of hospitality".   

After you're done laughing at Ang struggling for breath during the Jovial ad - Leave us a five-star review so your podcast player recommends Homemaker Chic to others who may like it and be sure to join us on Patreon:
www.patreon.com/homemakerchicpodcast for all the Homemaker treats and our seasonal FAN GIRL hangout!

item.description:
We're back!   And we're bringing along an inspiring domestic maven today, you all know and love her!  Welcome Farmhouse on Boone's, Lisa Bass!   We're picking her brain on how she came to be the skilled homemaker she is today and how her home and responsibilities have changed over the years.

To do:
1.  Leave Homemaker Chic a FIVE STAR review on your favorite podcast platform.   
2.  Join us over on www.patreon.com/homemakerchicpodcast for treats from Ang and Shaye, photos, articles we've written and our quarterly FAN GIRL hang out!

THE HOLIDAYS ARE COMING! Get your "penny bottle" now by visiting https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic
This is the part of the podcast where we encourage you to pour a glass of whatever scratches your itch, for us, that means a bottle of wine. Our wine segment is sponsored by Dry Farm Wines which is a fabulous online company that will ship you organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, no-garbage wines from all around the world. This is wine that is grown and bottled to help you tap into life and celebrate it!
Today Ang is sipping " Mo:Rot"  A wine made primarily of Zweigelt grape....this is Austria's main grape… it’s a dry red, easy-drinking, and great with fatty and rich flavors.  Think caramelized onions and rich bean stews!  Go ahead and serve this one lightly chilled!

Start stocking up for the Holidays with a bottle for a penny!   Visit  https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

Jovial Foods
It’s holiday time! And that means we’re going to be baking, tucking in, and nourishing our families. There’s no better way to do that then with Jovial Foods - amazing baking and food products to stock your pantry with. You can turn to Jovial for boxed pastas, olive oil, canned beans and tomatoes, cookies, crackers, einkorn berries, all-purpose flour, whole-grain flour, and more. www.jovialfoods.com
Coupon code: HOMEMAKER for a one time discount

item.description:
Another season in the BOOKS!   This season we hashed out the "hard things" and some definite overarching themes were discovered.   

We'll be on a little break until Season 4 on 11/2.   In the meantime, go check out all your old favorites and grab a glass of Dry Farm Wines!

CUE the WINE MUSIC!
Get your "penny bottle" now by visiting https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic
This is the part of the podcast where we encourage you to pour a glass of whatever scratches your itch, for us, that means a bottle of wine. Our wine segment is sponsored by Dry Farm Wines which is a fabulous online company that will ship you organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, no-garbage wines from all around the world. This is wine that is grown and bottled to help you tap into life and celebrate it!   Today's wine is a bubbly and we think you NEED some!   Try Dry Farm Wines along with the thousands of Homemaker Chic listeners who love it and let us know what YOU think!

American Blossom Linens  - COUPON CODE: HOMEMAKERCHIC20   We LOVE our modern vintage sheets made from Texas-grown cotton… no dyes, no imported fabrics here -  Turn your bedroom into an organic, chic oasis by using the promo code HOMEMAKERCHIC20, and get an exclusive 20% off discount just for listening to the show.

Toups & Co. https://toupsandco.com/

item.description:
Life in the Trenches Part II
Dignity? Routine?  Birth Control? Crock Pots?  We're here with you in the trenches.  Maintaining some semblance of sanity while mothering small children is possible, but you're not meant to do it alone.   Your bestie's Shaye and Ang are here.   With ten kids between the two of us, we KNOW life in the trenches and we've got your back.

CUE the WINE MUSIC!
Get your "penny bottle" now by visiting https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic
This is the part of the podcast where we encourage you to pour a glass of whatever scratches your itch, for us, that means a bottle of wine. Our wine segment is sponsored by Dry Farm Wines which is a fabulous online company that will ship you organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, no-garbage wines from all around the world. This is wine that is grown and bottled to help you tap into life and celebrate it!

Nine 56 Studio - Welcome to our new sponsor www.nine56studio.com Sustainable, luxury loungewear for homemakers, work-from-home mamas, and homebodies. (Sound familiar???). Chic, comfy styles you need to look and feel your best. We love their loungewear because it's ethically produced in the Midwest, sewn from organic cotton grown in the USA, garment-dyed with low-impact, non-toxic dyes, and shipped in eco-packaging.   From early morning strategy sessions at the kitchen table to chasing babes around the house, Nine 56 Studio luxury loungewear is created to help women find their work-from-home stride. Free shipping and return shipping in the US. Women-owned company.
20% off with discount code for our lovely Homemaker Chic Podcast listeners.   Use the code Chic20 for 20% off!  www.nine56studio.com

American Blossom Linens
 American Blossom Linens is the bedding that both Angela and I sleep on and so do many of our listeners.   We LOVE our modern vintage sheets made from Texas-grown cotton… no dyes, no imported fabrics here - American Blossom sheets are woven to literally last a lifetime.   Starting with the finest American Cotton, fibers are put through a process called combing that uses fine combs to pull out the shorter fibers and impurities. With ten children under 15 between the two of us, we understand life in the trenches.  Today we are skimming the top of the iceberg with laughs, encouragement, and Angela's desperate need for a cough button.

THE HOLIDAYS ARE COMING! Get your "penny bottle" now by visiting https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

This is wine that is grown and bottled to help you tap into life and celebrate it!
Today Ang is sipping a naturally fermented 2019 La Sagesse Touraine by Touraine.  This Sauvignon is from the clay, slate soil of the beautiful Loire Valley
Start stocking up for the Holidays with a bottle for a penny!   Visit  https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

American Blossom Linens  - COUPON CODE: HOMEMAKERCHIC20 American Blossom Linens is the bedding that both Shaye and I sleep on and so do many of our listeners.   We LOVE our modern vintage sheets made from Texas-grown cotton… no dyes, no imported fabrics here -  Turn your bedroom into an organic, chic oasis by using the promo code HOMEMAKERCHIC20, and get an exclusive 20% off discount just for listening to the show.

Jovial Foods. Jovial Foods is a company that supplies us homemakers with the most gorgeous baking flours and foods. Jovial is most well known for their einkorn flour, which is a high-protein, weak gluten flour that bakes up buttery and rich.  Amelie made the a delicious Einkorn chocolate cake this weekend.  My girls love to grab the Einkorn cookbook and try new things. This is a company that has an extreme love for high-quality ingredients which is why we welcome them into our pantries and into our kitchens. Visit them at jovialfoods.com and enjoy their free shipping!

item.description:
High horse?  High ground?  Naw girl... it's high passion that has us chewing over "food" that poses as food, migraines, brain fog, belly aches versus savory nourishment that allows us to LIVE so we can keep rescuing this FINE ART of homemaking.
While we may want to believe food intake is a subjective topic... the fact is, we homemakers are, for the most part... IN CHARGE of providing ourselves and our families with the best nutrition possible.   Is that possible at the average grocery store?  Is it possible with fast and easy effort?   Does it matter in the grand scheme of things?
In this episode, Shaye plays her inner "food snob" card and Ang talks about the French and their uncanny, intimidating portion control.  Today we talk about WHY do we feel so strongly about this particular topic and why we REALLY think it matters in view of Season 3's theme of "doing the hard things" and homemaking.   

THE HOLIDAYS ARE COMING! Get your "penny bottle" now by visiting https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

This is wine that is grown and bottled to help you tap into life and celebrate it!

We're still in Season 3 but we WILL be taking a one week break for our sanities sake.  Tune in again 10/5... In the meantime...  CUE the WINE MUSIC!

item.description:
Today we're talking about wanting to do it ALL and what's next on our "skilling up" list.   This fine art of homemaking gives us a chance to dabble at so many things, but what do you do with all that passion when there simply isn't enough time in the day?   Join us for some wine, and some beautiful banter about wanting to do it ALL.

CUE the WINE MUSIC!
Get your "penny bottle" now by visiting https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic
This is the part of the podcast where we encourage you to pour a glass of whatever scratches your itch, for us, that means a bottle of wine. Our wine segment is sponsored by Dry Farm Wines which is a fabulous online company that will ship you organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, no-garbage wines from all around the world. This is wine that is grown and bottled to help you tap into life and celebrate it!   Today's wine is a bubbly and we think you NEED some!   Try Dry Farm Wines along with the thousands of Homemaker Chic listeners who love it and let us know what YOU think!

Join Shaye's COOKING COMMUNITY!   
https://cook.theelliotthomestead.com/.  Skill up in the kitchen with your best gal pal, Shaye.   From basics to boeuf bourguignon become a better home cook, but don't do it ALONE!  Do it with friends!   

Nine 56 Studio - Welcome to our new sponsor www.nine56studio.com Sustainable, luxury loungewear for homemakers, work-from-home mamas, and homebodies. (Sound familiar???). Chic, comfy styles you need to look and feel your best. We love their loungewear because it's ethically produced in the Midwest, sewn from organic cotton grown in the USA, garment-dyed with low-impact, non-toxic dyes, and shipped in eco-packaging.   
20% off with discount code for our lovely Homemaker Chic Podcast listeners.   Use the code Chic20 for 20% off!  www.nine56studio.com

And old country song, I Want to do it All"
"I was sitting in traffic for the fifth year in a row
Wasting my time just to get where I don't even want to go
I started jotting things down on a Krispy Kreme sack
Everything I'd do if I could leave this place and never look back

I wanna do it all, visit Paris in the fall
Watch the Yankees play ball, I wanna take it all in
Catch a few beads down at Mardi Gras
Start a tradit

item.description:
From feeling like a sausage to missing being swamp women.   It's Monday and we're feeling our Cherrios (as Angela's Gramma would say).  Shaye had a come to Jesus moment about her LBD and Angela lost the peaches, for reals, but both of us are learning about to be our very best gardener on a limited fall schedule.  Join us?

CUE the WINE MUSIC!
Get your "penny bottle" now by visiting https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic
This is the part of the podcast where we encourage you to pour a glass of whatever scratches your itch, for us, that means a bottle of wine. Our wine segment is sponsored by Dry Farm Wines which is a fabulous online company that will ship you organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, no-garbage wines from all around the world. This is wine that is grown and bottled to help you tap into life and celebrate it!

Nine 56 Studio - Welcome to our new sponsor www.nine56studio.com Sustainable, luxury loungewear for homemakers, work-from-home mamas, and homebodies. (Sound familiar???). Chic, comfy styles you need to look and feel your best. We love their loungewear because it's ethically produced in the Midwest, sewn from organic cotton grown in the USA, garment-dyed with low-impact, non-toxic dyes, and shipped in eco-packaging.   From early morning strategy sessions at the kitchen table to chasing babes around the house, Nine 56 Studio luxury loungewear is created to help women find their work-from-home stride. Free shipping and return shipping in the US. Women-owned company.
20% off with discount code for our lovely Homemaker Chic Podcast listeners.   Use the code Chic20 for 20% off!  www.nine56studio.com

Jovial Foods is a company that supplies us homemakers with the most gorgeous baking flours and foods. Jovial is most well known for their einkorn flour, which is a high-protein, weak gluten flour that bakes up buttery and rich.  This is a company that has an extreme love for high quality ingredients which is why we welcome them into our pantries and into our kitchens. Visit them at jovialfoods.com and enjoy their free shipping.

Get a bottle for a penny with your first order of these beautiful, biodynamic wines. Low alcohol, no sugar added wines from Europe and beyond.
https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

item.description:
That's right girl... How DO you make the transition when it's 85 one day and 68 the next?  How do you decorate in a sustainable, cozy... GORGEOUS way for....drumroll............ FALL?   We're dishing all the inspiration you need.

CUE THE FALL WINE MUSIC! - Get a Bottle for a PENNY!
Angela is sipping Bauer Pötltl from the Austria and Dry Farm Wines
Today’s “What We’re Sipping” segment is brought to you by Dry Farm Wines. Dry Farms is an online wine subscription that pairs organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. As Dry Farm customers, we get to share in their love for organic, naturally and traditionally made wines. “Better, not more.” So check out their better wines. You can get either 3,6 or 12 bottles delivered to your door monthly. Drink Dry Farm Wines with Ang and Shaye! Shop and Sip at: https://bit.ly/ ryFarmWinewithHomemakerChic

Nine 56 Studio - Welcome to our new sponsor www.nine56studio.com Sustainable, luxury loungewear for homemakers, work-from-home mamas, and homebodies. (Sound familiar???). Chic, comfy styles you need to look and feel your best. We love their loungewear because it's ethically produced in the Midwest, sewn from organic cotton grown in the USA, garment-dyed with low-impact, non-toxic dyes, and shipped in eco-packaging.   From early morning strategy sessions at the kitchen table to chasing babes around the house, Nine 56 Studio luxury loungewear is created to help women find their work-from-home stride. Free shipping and return shipping in the US. Women-owned company. 
20% off with discount code for our lovely Homemaker Chic Podcast listeners.   Use the code Chic20 for 20% off!

Today's takeaway:
Bring the outdoors IN~
Avoid made in China garbage that will end up on next years garage sale pile.
You're a homemaker of many talents... THIS is your moment!  It's time to decorate!


SEASON SPONSOR DRY FARM WINES!
Get a bottle for a penny with your first order of these beautiful, biodynamic wines. Low alcohol, no sugar added wines from Europe and beyond.
https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

Find chemical-free, designer-quality skincare and makeup and save 10% with the code HMC10: https://toupsandco.com/

item.description:
While we're doing the hard things this season, let's learn to be better cooks too!   Today we're chatting "kitchen changing cookbooks" that helped us UP our game.   Turns out, it wasn't as difficult as we thought... even those pesky French recipes.

We for sure need a glass of wine for this episode!  CUE the WINE MUSIC!
Get your "penny bottle" now by visiting https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic
This is the part of the podcast where we encourage you to pour a glass of whatever scratches your itch, for us, that means a bottle of wine. Our wine segment is sponsored by Dry Farm Wines which is a fabulous online company that will ship you organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar,, no-garbage wines from all around the world.  What kind of garbage am I talking about?  Well, the 76 ingredients that legally DON’T have to be listed on the back of your wine label.   No GMO yeast, no PURPLE DYE, (yes there’s a reason your teeth turn purple, that’s NOT natural) This is wine that is grown and bottled to help you tap into life and celebrate it!

And now for some flavor!   Today's show is also brought to you by...
San Juan Island Sea Salt - order yours today!   Salts, rubs, herbs... all harvested using zero electricity! They are "more than just salt"  visit https://www.sanjuanislandseasalt.com/home

Jovial Foods is a company that supplies us homemakers with the most gorgeous baking flours and foods. Jovial is most well known for their einkorn flour, which is a high-protein, weak gluten flour that bakes up buttery and rich.  This is a company that has an extreme love for high quality ingredients which is why we welcome them into our pantries and into our kitchens. Visit them at jovialfoods.com and enjoy their free shipping.



SEASON SPONSOR DRY FARM WINES!
Get a bottle for a penny with your first order of these beautiful, biodynamic wines. Low alcohol, no sugar added wines from Europe and beyond.
https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

Get luxury linens from our friends at American Blossom Linens and save 20% with code SING20: https://americanblossomlinens.com

Find chemical-free, designer-quality skincare and makeup and save 10% with the code HMC10: https://toupsandco.com/

Clean, CLEAN with Branch Basics! https://branchbasics.com/ Coupon code HOMEMAKERCHIC

If you enjoy wine, drink Dry Farms: https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

Want to skill up in the kitchen? Visit cook.theelliotthomestead.com for 5 new recipes and tutorials a month!

item.description:
Anyone else off the workout wagon since Covid?   Or maybe you've always wanted to just get a little bit stronger to get through your day as a homemaker?   Today we're chatting our fitness insecurities, histories, and deciding once again that this season's theme is on POINT, that we can do the hard thing.  Working out.

Get a bottle of wine for a penny and cue the wine music!
https://www.dryfarmwines.com/pages/pennybottlelp?rfsn=2479198.660dce
Today’s “What We’re Sipping” segment is brought to you by Dry Farm Wines. Dry Farms is an online wine subscription that pairs organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. As Dry Farm customers, we get to share in their love for organic, naturally and traditionally made wines. We love them because their wine is delicious - it challenges and explores your wine palette in all the right ways - and their wine makes you feel good!

Today’s episode is brought to you by:
American Blossom Linens  - Turn your bedroom into an organic, chic oasis by using the promo code HOMEMAKERCHIC20, and get an exclusive 20% off discount just for listening to the show.

Jovial Foods. Jovial Foods is a company that supplies us, homemakers, with the most gorgeous baking flours and foods. Jovial is most well known for their einkorn flour, which is a high-protein, weak gluten flour that bakes up buttery and rich.  Visit them at jovialfoods.com and enjoy their free shipping!

Stay in touch on Youtube and Instagram!

As Dry Farm customers, we get to share in their love for organic, naturally and traditionally made wines. We love them because their wine is delicious - it challenges and explores your wine palette in all the right ways - and their wine makes you feel good! As with all things, “better, not more.”
Angela was sipping an Austrian Blaufränkisch from the Carnuntum region.   A 2018 natural wine sourced from Dry Farm.   Let this wine age for TEN YEARS for maximum fabulousness.   This is a red bled of grapes from on sand, clay and slate.  Each 15 km apart.   Cool flavors and minerally.   Just the way we like it and we know YOU will to.   Give a Dry Farm subscription a try today!

Today’s episode is brought to you by:
Jovial Foods. Jovial Foods is a company that supplies us homemakers with the most gorgeous baking flours and foods. Jovial is most well known for their einkorn flour, which is a high-protein, weak gluten flour that bakes up buttery and rich.  Amelie made the a delicious Einkorn chocolate cake this weeked.  My girls love to grab the Einkorn cookbook and try new things. This is a company that has an extreme love for high quality ingredients which is why we welcome them into our pantries and into our kitchens. Visit them at jovialfoods.com and enjoy their free shipping!

Today’s Quick Tip for Your Home: Set the mood with music. Current favs: Django Reinhart, Melody Garot, Ray LaMontagne. Blast it!  Don't forget to keep that speaker charged.

Other notes:

  • Shaye's dress was purchased Cotton Candy Wear on Etsy
  • Our gardening inspiration is coming from this book this week!

item.description:
Does your life feel like a computer browser with 173 tabs open?   Has the modern world contributed to a disconnect between yourself and your humanity?   Guess what girlfriend - you're NOT a machine and the need for rest, creativity, friends, quiet... it's NOT your imagination.  You ACTUALLY need those things!

RECOMMENDED READING:
Laura Ingalls Wilder's Little Town: https://amzn.to/2XoVWxJ
A very interesting look at how her community and traditions shaped the world of our favorite heroine.   

Essentialism: https://amzn.to/3i1GSy4
Focused on entrepreneurs, but with useful ideas for the homemaker, this book offers excellent thoughts on boiling down what you need to be putting your hand to.   When to say "yes" and when to say - "that's NOT essential".

Today’s Quick Tip for Your Home: Do one load of laundry A DAY. START TO FINISH. It can be hard to get in this habit, but it certainly beats washing seven on Saturday when you’d rather be out doing something awesome. Gives you time to pay attention, clean pockets, see the garments, iron and appreciate them. Keep a sheet in the laundry room to write down what you need (ie: girls need new socks, husband needs white shirts, etc.)

CUE THE WINE MUSIC!    Today’s “What We’re Sipping” segment is brought to you by Dry Farm Wines. Today Angela was sipping a Chateau Castellas, Les Escots 2018, a Malbec made by the Roucanieres family.   They’ve been making wine here for 200 years. This is one of the dark reds so far from Dry Farms.. dark fruit flavors and rich with tannins.   For our friends that like a big, French red, You're going to LOVE this one!   
Visit www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic and be SURE to grab your first bottle for JUST A PENNY!

We’re Not Machines
Today we’re talking about the ebbs and flows of life. The seasons of our lives and how those changes. We’re not machines! And thus, it stands to reason that our needs change, our desires change, our motivation changes, our dreams change.
As women our bodies are already designed for cycles, why would we imagine that our lives, moods, abilities, passions, wouldn't reflect this as well?

We’re not machines. Therefore;

  • We should expect a cyclical nature to life, work, friendships, etc.
  • We should expect

item.description:
SO YOU’RE GONNA HOMESCHOOL
Our hearts are with so many families who are choosing to homeschool for a variety of reasons this year.  Whatever the reason, take a deep breath.   We've got some hopeful wise words for you and great resources!

Today’s episode is brought to you by: OUR AMAZON LINK
https://amzn.to/3fdxEgu
Shop Amazon for ANYTHING with this link at no extra cost to you!

For the new (and seasoned) Homeschool family...

  • Few things to remember:
    • You can’t create “the” classroom environment in your home. It’s stifling and torture.  Don’t try to duplicate it.
    • YOU’RE the one in charge (it may be time to brush up yourself).   You may find a little less Netflix and more filling your mind in the evening keeps you on your toes:)
    • Ask yourself: what’s important to our family? What can we cut out of the schedule to make this as efficient and effective as possible?
    • YOU HAVE CHOICES. 
  • The most important thing is CHARACTER and GOOD HABITS.
    • Recommended books: Laying Down the Rails -found here: https://amzn.to/315CIOT
    • Connoisseur Kids -found here: https://amzn.to/2UM6Cp6
    • Real Learning, Education in the Heart of the Home (Out of print, expensive and TOTALLY WORHT EVERY PENNY) -found here: https://amzn.to/339Hy05
  • Be flexible.  Make it more about routine than schedule.
  • Find community and support, .
    • HSLDA, https://hslda.org/

OTHER HELPFUL LINKS:

  • Angela’s homeschool video, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dC6LwcP0AyY&t=721s
  • Shaye’s homeschool video
  • Read Aloud Revival  https://readaloudrevival.com/
  • Explode the Code: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B079NRDB28?ie=UTF8&tag=homemakerch03-20&camp=1789&linkCode=xm2&creativeASIN=B079NRDB28
  • Sonlight

item.description:
From pitted out farm t-shirts to children who are wearing floods and snow boots in public... our clothing is SPENT from wind, sun and growth spurts.   WHAT are we gonna do with these slow fashion convictions and the reality of clothing ourselves and a growing family?

item.description:
Life-changing lit for the homemaker!  Oh, this is a FUN one!   We scoured our libraries and pulled out a pile of books that have made a profound impact on our homemaking.   Some of these books are inspiring, and others have literally pointed our lives in a direction that has brought us to where we are today.  ALL the titles are here for you in the show notes!

CUE THE WINE MUSIC! https://bit.ly/ ryFarmWinewithHomemakerChic  Today’s “What We’re Sipping” segment is brought to you by Dry Farm Wines. Dry Farms is an online wine subscription that pairs organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world.  “better, not more.” You can get either 3,6 or 12 bottles delivered to your door monthly.   No wine shopping in a mask required:) and no more wine aisle anxiety!
Drink Dry Farm Wines with Ang and Shaye!   Shop and Sip at:  https://bit.ly/ ryFarmWinewithHomemakerChic

Jovial Foods. Jovial is most well known for their einkorn flour, which is a high-protein, weak gluten flour that bakes up buttery and rich. This flour will make your homemade scones, breads, pies, and cakes taste so much better!  Free shipping too!

American Blossom Linens  - Turn your bedroom into an organic, chic oasis by using the promo code HOMEMAKERCHIC20, and get an exclusive 20% off discount just for listening to the show.

The Balanced Plate

Fit for Life

item.description:
Better, not more?   Where to focus our efforts first?   WHAT is essential?   We're going to dive into clearing the noise, the mental space, and all the heart clutter so we can be BETTER homemakers.   Maybe it will help Shaye be able to pronounce wine names too...

Books we mentioned:   
Essentialism

Today's Sponsors:

What's We're Sipping
www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic
The “What We’re Sipping” segment today is brought to you by Dry Farm Wines. Dry Farms is a wine supplier that pairs organic, biodynamic, low-sugar, low-alcohol wines from all over the world with customers that share their love for organic, naturally and traditionally made wines. We love them because their wine is delicious, unfussy, and oh-so-good.  Check out more about Dry Farms in the show notes.

Toups & Co is your one-stop-shop for all-natural and organic skincare and makeup! Visit their site at toupsandco.com to enjoy their line of serums, soaps, lotions, shampoo bars, mineral makeup, lipstick, and more! Use code HOMEMAKER for a discount!

www.jovialfoods.com
Jovial Foods is an amazing company, run by husband and wife team Carla and Rodolfo. After they discovered years ago that their daughter had gluten sensitivity, they struck out to find grains that her body could easily digest and thrive off eating - and that led them to einkorn. Einkorn is an ancient variety of wheat - the oldest we know of - that our bodies flourish off of because of its high protein and extremely weak gluten. Now, Jovial Foods is the top supplier of einkorn flours, einkorn pastas, Italian olive oils, prepackaged einkorn snacks, and the top-rated gluten-free pasta line. I’ve hardly met anyone in my life more intent on quality ingredients and quality products than Carla - I continually fall in love with the quality of these products (especially that buttery, rich, einkorn flour that I use to bake everything with!). You must try this flour! It’ll change your baking life.

Our love comment this week is from:  NourishedMinds
Thank you for staying in your lane! Let me just say! It is such a RELIEF to be around two women who are wise, hilarious, and have many insightful things to say. The two of you always make me think twice about my day, my attitude, and even yesterday I made a few changes in my home per your podcast. Thank you for sticking to what you set out to do because I don’t kno

item.description:
What's HE sipping?  In our interview, today Todd White, the founder of Dry Farm Wines shares with us what's REALLY going on in the wine industry... why we feel bad after drinking conventional wine and why our teeth look PURPLE???
You won't BELIEVE what Todd has to share with us today and he's got a great Penny Bottle special for our listeners who want to go au natural with their wine choices.    Get your PENNY WINE at www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic and give a wine subscription a try!

Our LOVE comment:
A private message over on IG from Sofia Diaz
Dear friends, can I call you friends?  I'm sure I can and I'll explain why... I wait for your podcast eagerly and not because you give voice to my thoughts or because I
agree with you but because you challenge me to check myself... to check myself to be present or to put love and grace into my every action, to be creative... and so I listen,  and go on thru my day having this amazingly fun conversation in my mind explaining my points in disagreement and supporting you every time you are struggling as we do with friends.   Do you feel it?  I'm sure you do.   Our conversations are fruitful and I find myself being a better person because of it.

What to do with a big yellow jar of mustard?   Or our total boredom with standard picnic fare?  We've got solutions!   What is it about summer that just makes you want to have people over?   It's time to toss the bocce and light the tiki torches. Summer entertaining is HERE and we've got our tips, pointers, and highlights for you. 

CUE THE WINE MUSIC!
Angela is sipping la Fruitiere from the Loire Valley and Dry Farm Wines
Today’s “What We’re Sipping” segment is brought to you by Dry Farm Wines. Dry Farms is an online wine subscription that pairs organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. Summer entertaining is HERE and we've got our tips, pointers, and highlights for you.

Angela is sipping la Fruitiere from the Loire Valley and Dry Farm Wines

item.description:
Today we are answering one of our most popular questions - How can you make a rental truly look and FEEL like home?   From velcro to staple guns, today we're helping you turn your rental into a chic environment that gives you ALL the feels!

CUE THE WINE MUSIC! Today’s “What We’re Sipping” segment is brought to you by Dry Farm Wines. Dry Farms is an online wine subscription that pairs organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. As Dry Farm customers, we get to share in their love for organic, naturally and traditionally made wines.  “better, not more.” So check out their better wines. You can get either 3,6 or 12 bottles delivered to your door monthly.
Drink Dry Farm Wines with Ang and Shaye!   Shop and Sip at:  https://bit.ly/ ryFarmWinewithHomemakerChic

Jovial Foods. Jovial Foods is a company that supplies us homemakers with the most gorgeous baking flours and foods. Jovial is most well known for their einkorn flour, which is a high-protein, weak gluten flour that bakes up buttery and rich. This flour will make your homemade scones, breads, pies, and cakes taste so much better!  Free shipping too!

American Blossom Linens  - American Blossom Linens is the bedding that both Shaye and I sleep on and so do many of our listeners.   We LOVE our modern vintage sheets made from Texas-grown cotton… no dyes, no imported fabrics here -  Turn your bedroom into an organic, chic oasis by using the promo code HOMEMAKERCHIC20, and get an exclusive 20% off discount just for listening to the show.

Our love comment this week is from: 

Fancypantsfarmlady on Apple podcast reviews 05/26/2020

"Uniquely inspired - I thought I had rated the podcast already, but I was wrong. So here I am correcting that mistake.I thoroughly enjoy the content here. I receive just enough insight, encouragement and inspiration to propel me into the depths of my own creativity to make my family, my home, and my own life beautiful to me. Like so many others, I feel like I have truly met my soul sisters here. I find myself excited often, when I hear Shaye or Angela say or do something I thought I was alone in."





SEASON SPONSOR DRY FARM WINES!
Get a bottle for a penny with your first order of these beautiful, biodynamic wines. Low alcohol, no sugar added wines from Europe and beyond.

item.description:
How DOES a homemaker have a heart that's content?   Join us for an unplanned conversation where we hash out ideas on contentment, thankfulness, and happiness even in the midst of needing new washing machines or nursing a sick child.   CAN we be content when the modern message is that 'happiness' is just one more purchase away?   We're working through our thoughts most spontaneously today.  Warning:  there will be some faith, some laughter and some tears.

Join us on Patreon at www.patreon.com/homemakerchicpodcast.   Get free digital copies of our cookbooks, our printable #pitlist, join the Discord call AND the monthly homemaker live stream party when you become a patron of the podcast!

item.description:
If education is an atmosphere then how do we keep our children learning all summer long without them realizing it's "summer school" and what does Mom and Dad need to do to foster that environment?   Watercolors and frogs?   Pianos and downtime?  We're exploring this beautiful topic today!

Jovial Foods. Jovial Foods is a company that supplies us homemakers with the most gorgeous baking flours and foods. Jovial is most well known for their einkorn flour, which is a high-protein, weak gluten flour that bakes up buttery and rich. This flour will make your homemade scones, breads, pies, and cakes taste so much better!  Free shipping too!

American Blossom Linens  - American Blossom Linens is the bedding that both Shaye and I sleep on and so do many of our listeners.   We LOVE our modern vintage sheets made from Texas-grown cotton… no dyes, no imported fabrics here -  Turn your bedroom into an organic, chic oasis by using the promo code HOMEMAKERCHIC20, and get an exclusive 20% off discount just for listening to the show.

CUE THE WINE MUSIC! Today’s “What We’re Sipping” segment is brought to you by Dry Farm Wines. Dry Farms is an online wine subscription that pairs organic, biodynamic, naturally yeasted, low-sugar, lower-alcohol wines from all over the world. As Dry Farm customers, we get to share in their love for organic, naturally and traditionally made wines.  “better, not more.” So check out their better wines. You can get either 3,6 or 12 bottles delivered to your door monthly.
Drink Dry Farm Wines with Ang and Shaye!   Shop and Sip at:  https://bit.ly/ ryFarmWinewithHomemakerChic

Takeaway - Education is an atmosphere.  So enjoy your summer by giving your children a creative, free environment in which to learn and "summer school" will happen naturally.

item.description:
From one episode a week... to two,  from wondering, "Will anyone listen to this show?" to being a TOP rated Apple Podcast within the first few weeks.   From wondering "Will anyone sponsor us?" to having the BEST sponsors ever!  You made us a HIT and we love you for it.... Even if your trash is showing.
We're celebrating a SOLID season of fleshing out ideas and a hysterical season of some jokes that have become evergreen on the show.   Karen and her trash being one of them 'cause we'd all agree Karen needs to calm the heck down and be kind!
We've rocked our red lips, shared our love story, our fails... we've opined on fashion and food production and we're SO glad you were here with us.   
This is it - the finalé~   (Don't panic, we'll be back in a fortnight!")
Don't forget!  Show you chic love with a five-star rating and a review!   

We're sipping our Dry Farm Wines!
Dry Farm Wines curates only the highest quality natural wines from small, sustainable family farms that meet our strict standard of health. Unlike today's commercialized and processed wines, this is real wine. Nothing added, nothing removed.   We LOVE that now SO many of you of sipping what WE'RE sipping!

Pure, artisanal, and deliciously clean.

  • Sugar-Free (< 1g/L)
  •  Lower Sulfites (< 75ppm)
  •  Lower Alcohol (< 12.5%)
  •  Mycotoxin/Mold-Free
  •  No Industrial Additives

Sleep Chic with our FAVORITE linens company!  Get your modern vintage sheets at americanblossomlinens.com with the 20% off promo code HOMEMAKERCHIC20.
Sleep fabulous this spring in your new “modern vintage” sheets.   Woven to last and feel fabulous. This is the same weave used in most luxury hotel bedding and the quality heirloom sheets your grandparents used!   Bed by bed we're going through our homes and changing ALL our linens over to American Blossom Linens.   We know you'll sleep fabulous and chic, just like we are:)

Jovial Foods. www.jovialfoods.com
Jovial Foods is an amazing company, run by husband and wife team Carla and Rodolfo. After they discovered years ago that their daughter had a gluten sensitivity, they struck out to find grains that her body could easily digest and thrive off eating - and that led them to einkorn. Einkorn is an ancient variety of w


SEASON SPONSOR DRY FARM WINES!
Get a bottle for a penny with your first order of these beautiful, biodynamic wines. Low alcohol, no sugar added wines from Europe and beyond.
https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

Get luxury linens from our friends at American Blossom Linens and save 20% with code SING20: https://americanblossomlinens.com

Find chemical-free, designer-quality skincare and makeup and save 10% with the code HMC10: https://toupsandco.com/

Clean, CLEAN with Branch Basics! https://branchbasics.com/ Coupon code HOMEMAKERCHIC

If you enjoy wine, drink Dry Farms: https://www.dryfarmwines.com/homemakerchic

We'd love to see you over on Instagram.  Be sure to share how your kicking butt and taking names by taging @homemakerchicpodcast and using the hashtag #pitlist when you get a project done or even the littlest thing on your list!   

We've got one more episode on Season One.  Thank you for making our new show a roaring success!    Because of YOU, Homemaker Chic is a top-rated Apple Podcast in the US and Great Britain!   We'll be celebrating Season One with a Live Stream Party, Friday, May 30th so make sure you're a Patron, we'll be toasting with our Dry Farm Wines and partying with YOU Karen!  Patreon is a way that you can show your love for our podcast by contributing $5 or $10/month and in return, we’re going to show OUR love with a digital copy of each of our cookbooks AND the new #pitlist PDF and.... item.description:
Green onion wraps, half-dead moles and Superman pajama bottoms?!   That's right Karen!  We're celebrating Shaye's birthday by going back to the world of entertaining and hospitality with a touch of kitten love and airport attire thrown into the mix.  Angela is non-apologetic about pyjama's at the airport and Momma Mia Shaye is whipping up some Italian gnocchi for her birthday.   It's Freestyle Blursday after all!

Don't forget!  Show your chic love with a five-star rating and a review!   

Give your palette what it's craving with Dry Farm Wines.  What are YOU sipping today?  Drink Dry Farm Wines with Ang and Shaye!   Shop and Sip at:  https://bit.ly/DryFarmWinewithHomemakerChic 

Dry Farm Wines curates only the highest quality natural wines from small, sustainable family farms that meet our strict standard of health. Unlike today's commercialized and processed wines, this is real wine. Nothing added, nothing removed.   We LOVE that now SO many of you of sipping what WE'RE sipping!

Pure, artisanal, and deliciously clean.

  • Sugar-Free (< 1g/L)
  •  Lower Sulfites (< 75ppm)
  •  Lower Alcohol (< 12.5%)
  •  Mycotoxin/Mold-Free
  •  No Industrial Additives

Our LOVE comment for the week is from @The_oglesby_ohana: “NEEDED THIS. As I was so confident going into this year's gardening season only to feel like I’m failing. NEVERTHELESS, I shall gird my loins and march forward with fortitude and grit. I will be a fabulous gardener one day. And these failings will teach me! Knowing that you ladies have failed gives me confidence - hahahaha. Sadly and oddly. HA!”

item.description:
Shaye's birthday present will be late and Angela can't make chocolate chip cookies and she doesn't want any outside intervention.   She's owning it.  Shaye can leave a trail of death and destruction in her barnyard.... today is all about our EPIC fails.   And to tell the truth, sometimes it's been really tough to pull ourselves up and try again.   

"A man learns nothing from winning.  The act of losing, however, can elicit great wisdom.  Not least of which is, how much more enjoyable it is to win.  It’s inevitable to lose now and again.   The trick is not to make a habit of it." - Uncle Henry from the movie A Good Year

Quarantine survival: Shaye's kids are playing with Perler Beads
Angela's binging on Trey Kennedy videos! 

We're sipping our Dry Farm Wines!
Dry Farm Wines curates only the highest quality natural wines from small, sustainable family farms that meet our strict standard of health. Unlike today's commercialized and processed wines, this is real wine. Nothing added, nothing removed.   We LOVE that now SO many of you of sipping what WE'RE sipping!

Pure, artisanal, and deliciously clean.

  • Sugar-Free (< 1g/L)
  •  Lower Sulfites (< 75ppm)
  •  Lower Alcohol (< 12.5%)
  •  Mycotoxin/Mold-Free
  •  No Industrial Additives

Don't forget!  Show you chic love with a five-star rating and a review!   

Clearly we're attracting some like-minded gap pals.... this girl cracking us up over on Instagram @homemakerchicpodcast
@tanja1036b says:  SO I was struggling to find time to listen to the podcast without interruption until today.  My husband and I telework right now and we are should to shoulder at our desks.   Every single noise he made, chewing his food, breathing, talking out loud, you get the picture. To save our marriage I plugged in my headphones and started your podcast and now I am blissfully working with your friendly voices are in my ear..."

item.title: All the feminine feels.
item.itunes:summary: "Crazy.   We're crazy for feeling so lonely?"  Cue the Patsy Cline. What are we craving and WHY?   "Stuck" at home and channeling women of bygone era's?   Someone send petticoats and flapper fringe because we have no idea what we're doing here, all we know is that we want to feel feminine.
